source_sentence: 至已諸白衣掘取官久摩(翻欝金香)還罽賓種。
translation: When they arrived, the white coats dug up the fragrant gold from the Kāṇḍuma valley and returned it to the Kāśmīra plant.

source_sentence: 是時香醉山中諸龍王瞋。
translation: The nāga kings on Mount Gandhamādana were angry.
Madaudi taught him to subdue them.
The dragon kings asked Matiṣṭrapāla.
"How long will the Bhagavān Dharmâkara abide?
Matiṣṭrapati replied.
'It's been a thousand years since the dragon kings made a promise.
Until the Buddha's dharma abides, he'll hear about it and stay in that country.'
Matiṣṭrapati replied.
"So it is.

source_sentence: 時末田地取欝金香至罽賓國種。
translation: Matiṣṭadi then took Ucchuṣma and planted it in Kāśmīra.
That's how the Bhagavān's dharma treasure came to abide.
Madaudi then widely disseminated the Dharma treasury.
He showed various supernormal powers and talked to the patrons.

It's like when water goes out of the fire.

source_sentence: 以牛頭旃檀種種香木闍維其身。
translation: He maintained his body with a variety of scented wood from the ox head sandalwood.
He collected his relics and built a stūpa for them.

It was then that the elder Ānanda entered nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 時舍那婆私往摩偷羅國。
translation: Śāṇabhadra then went to the country of Mahākauṣṭhila.

source_sentence: 於中路有寺名貧陀婆那(翻叢林)。
translation: In the middle of the road there was a temple named Pauṇḍapanthaka (which translates as "jungle").
Śāṇabhadra stayed at the temple for one night.
At the temple, there were two elderly monks.
They had a discussion and spoke a verse.

source_sentence: 無犯第一戒　　擇法第一聞
translation: "Don't violate the first precept; choose the best teaching and hear the best.

source_sentence: 是比丘謂是　　舍那婆私說
translation: This monk said that it was Śānabhadra who spoke...
Śānava then spoke privately to the two monks.
"The meaning you're describing is not mine to explain.
The true combination of dharmas is what I've explained.

source_sentence: 長老先過去世於波羅捺國有一商主。
translation: "Elder, there was a merchant in the country of Vārāṇasī in a past life.
He was with 500 merchants who wanted to enter the ocean.
On his way there, he saw that Pratibhāna Buddha was ill.

source_sentence: 商主留諸估客看辟支佛。
translation: The merchant owner left the valuers to watch Vaiśravaṇa.

source_sentence: 以醫所說藥商主親自料理。
translation: The merchant took care of it himself with medicines prescribed by a physician.
At that point, Pṛthivī was quite ill.
At the time, the merchant owner took Śāna's robe.
The garment was originally coarse.
He rinsed and dyed it to make it soft and smooth.
He gave the bathing Buddha Pratibhāna's robe as a gift.
He said.
"Bhagavān!
'This garment is coarse and raw.'
After bathing it, the Bhagavān wishes to accept it.
Prakaraṇa replied.
"Good sons!
'I'm an old man.
I left home with Śānabhadra.
I covered my body with this robe and attained the noble teaching.
Now, I'll wear this robe until I enter nirvāṇa.
The merchant owner said.
'Don't enter nirvāṇa!'

source_sentence: 乃至我入海還當以衣服飲食臥具醫藥供養世尊。
translation: Even if I go back into the ocean, I'll make offerings to the Bhagavān with clothing, food, bedding, and medicine.
Until I enter nirvāṇa, then I won't enter nirvāṇa.
Now, I won't be able to stay here if I go into the ocean.'
The pratyekabuddha said.
'Now, I have no choice but to enter nirvāṇa.'
You've already made a great effort.
You must rejoice!

source_sentence: 時辟支佛即為商主現十八變。
translation: That's when the pratyekabuddha Buddha showed the merchant eighteen transformations.
After his miraculous powers, he then entered nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 商主供養其身作此誓願。
translation: The merchant owner made offerings to his body and made this vow.
'I've cultivated all this monk's merits.

source_sentence: 以此善根如其所得我當得之。
translation: Because of these good roots, as he has attained them, I will attain them.'
The merchant monk was me.

source_sentence: 是故我今值最勝師令我得道。
translation: Now, therefore, I've found the most excellent teacher who will make me attain the way.
I put on the robes of Śānabhadra.
I left home at the Bhagavān's dharma-store.
With my body covered by Śānabhadra, I attained the Way.

source_sentence: 以舍那婆私覆身入涅槃。
translation: With my body covered by śānavastu, I entered nirvāṇa.
I've always worn śanavastu.
I also wore this robe where I was clothed in white.
That's why I'm called Śānavaśikhin.

source_sentence: 我受具足第四羯磨竟復受大受。
translation: After I fully undergo the fourth kalpa, I'll again undergo the great reception.

source_sentence: 乃至未入涅槃恒著舍那婆私。
translation: Even before I entered nirvāṇa, I'd always wear śanavastu.
Therefore, I'm again called Śānabhadra.

source_sentence: 是時長老舍那婆私次第行至摩偷羅國。
translation: The elder Śāṇabhadra then traveled sequentially to the country of Mahākauṣṭhila.

source_sentence: 往優流漫陀山坐於繩床。
translation: He went to Mount Urumaṇḍa and sat on a rope-bottomed seat.

source_sentence: 優流漫陀山有二龍王兄弟。
translation: On Mount Urumaṇḍa there were two dragon kings and brothers.
They were accompanied by 500 dragons.
Śānabhadra thought.
'Unless I subdue them, I won't be able to teach them.'
He then moved the mountain with his supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 二龍王瞋往舍那婆私處。
translation: The two dragon kings angrily went to Śānabhadra's private quarters.
A violent wind and rain arose, and a fire was started.

source_sentence: 舍那婆私入慈三昧能令風雨及火不近其身。
translation: Śāṇabhadra entered the samādhi of kindness, which kept the wind, rain, and fire from coming near him.
It transforms all that water and fire into smallpox.

source_sentence: 謂優鉢羅花拘牟頭分陀利花等悉皆墮地。
translation: Upalakṣa flowers, kumuda flowers, and puṇḍarī flowers all fall to the ground.

source_sentence: 復起雷電亦以神力變其雷電皆成天花。
translation: When thunder and lightning arise, they also transform those thunderbolts into smallpox with their supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 復以種種器仗欲擲舍那婆私。
translation: They also want to toss various weapons at Śānabhadra.
They also transformed them into smallpoxes with their supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 復以大山欲壓舍那婆私。
translation: Again, he wanted to crush Śānabhadra with a huge mountain.
It also transforms that large mountain into smallpox.
In the air, he immediately spoke a verse, saying.

source_sentence: 暴風疾雨　　不能為害　　雷電器仗　變為天花　　譬如雪山　　日光所照　悉皆鎔消　　無有遺餘　　入慈三昧　火不能燒　　器仗毒害　　不近其身於是二龍王往舍那婆私處白言。
translation: "A stormy wind and a torrential rain can't harm a thunderbolt, and it turns into a smallpox like a snow-capped mountain that's completely obliterated by the sun's rays and leaves nothing behind. Fire can't burn it, and the poison from the container won't reach it.
"What did the sage tell me to do?
Śāṇabhadra replied.
"I want to build a temple on this mountain.
You must listen to me.
The dragon king answered, "You can't get it.
"It's impossible to get there.
The elder said.
"The Bhagavān has recorded this.
'One hundred years after I enter nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 於大醍醐山寂靜最勝處當起寺。
translation: I'll build a temple on Mount Daigo in the quiet, most excellent place.
It'll be called Nādavatā.
The dragon king then replied.
"Has the Bhagavān already written this down?
The elder replied.
"So it is.
The dragon king said.
"If the Bhagavān has memorized this, I'll listen.
The elder then considered and observed.

source_sentence: 那哆婆哆寺檀越為生已未。
translation: "Has the donor from Nāgârjuna Temple yet been born?
He saw that he had already been born.

source_sentence: 時舍那婆私早起著衣持鉢入偷羅國乞食。
translation: Then Śāṇabhadra rose early, put on his robe, and took his bowl into the country of Śāla to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 乞食已往那哆婆哆檀越處。
translation: After soliciting alms, he went to the donor at Nāgârjuna.
When he arrived, he said to the donor.
"Good man!
'You must give me money.
I want to build a temple on Mount Daigo.

source_sentence: 那哆婆哆兄弟二人語舍那婆私。
translation: The two brothers Nātavadā said to Śānabhadra.
"I can't do that.
The elder said.

source_sentence: 佛已記汝二人於大醍醐山當起寺。
translation: "The Buddha has written down a plan for you two to build a temple on Mount Daigo.
They answered, "If the Buddha has written it down, I will build a temple.
"If the Buddha has written that down for me, I will build a temple.
They'll build a monastery on that mountain.
Their clothing and other necessities were all complete.
That's why they call this temple Nādavatī.
